page.title: 04HOMES IN HIGH HURSTWOOD
page.content: One result of the ban on new housing is that enterprising people have bought available property and converted it often on a do-it-yourself basis. There is a converted Oast house and some old stone farm labourers' cottages have been extended or combined to make one larger house out of two small ones. In other cases larger houses have been divided to give two or three separate units. One of the more ambitious projects is the conversion of a granary done by the owner almost single-handed over a period of years. Within the past l2 months the former village shop has become a home because when the previous owner and shopkeeper retired no-one could be found to continue to run the business. The village is now without a shop to the regret of many residents.
